cluster_relations.rel_desc: Posture is identified as a key component of body language.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject is a component, aspect, or example of the object, which represents a larger whole, system, or category.

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Gestures are a type of nonverbal behavior that functions as part of body language.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject is a component, aspect, or example of the object, which represents a larger whole, system, or category.

qualifiers.OtherQualifier: TypeOfNonverbal: gestures as part of body language

remarks: Relation inferred from conceptual grouping; text implies gestures are within body language.
Relation inferred from conceptual grouping; text implies gestures are within body language.
Relation inferred from conceptual grouping; text implies gestures are within body language.

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Posture is treated as a specific aspect of body language that people can observe and be mindful of.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject is a specific aspect, feature, or component of the broader phenomenon described by the object.

qualifiers.OtherQualifier: Implied by sequencing of posture and body language discussion

remarks: Semantics partly rely on domain knowledge that posture is a form of body language; text implies but does not state it explicitly.
Semantics partly rely on domain knowledge that posture is a form of body language; text implies but does not state it explicitly.
Semantics partly rely on domain knowledge that posture is a form of body language; text implies but does not state it explicitly.

args.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject is a component, aspect, or example of the object, which represents a larger whole, system, or category.
args.justification: This relation has the same semantics as the other two instances (posture/gestures as parts or aspects of body language). To maintain a consistent predicate and class across semantically identical composition relations, normalize from 'is_aspect_of' and 'nonverbal_component_relation' to the already used 'is_component_of' and 'component_whole_relation'.
args.remark: Normalized to align with other component relations linking parts/aspects to body language.

executed_decisions.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject is a component, aspect, or example of the object, which represents a larger whole, system, or category.
executed_decisions.justification: This relation has the same semantics as the other two instances (posture/gestures as parts or aspects of body language). To maintain a consistent predicate and class across semantically identical composition relations, normalize from 'is_aspect_of' and 'nonverbal_component_relation' to the already used 'is_component_of' and 'component_whole_relation'.
executed_decisions.remark: Normalized to align with other component relations linking parts/aspects to body language.
